item.description:
The closing film of the Hartford International Film Festival.

Director: Nabil Elderkin US & Uganda, 2010 | 74 min. After making music videos for everyone from Will.I.Am to Kanye West, Nabil Elderkin has made an astonishing film on the positive effect of hip-hop dance on youths in Ugandaa country burned over by colonialism, director Idi Amin, poverty, and ethnic warfare. The film follows hip hop artist Crazy Legs (of Rock Steady Crew) as he travels with Abrahmz Tekya, a b-boy devotee who established Break-dance Project Uganda to teach hundreds of Ugandan youths to express themselves through dance. While the film shows that Uganda is one of the worst places on earth to be a child, it is also a testament to the resilience of young people, and the power of hip hop culture as a weapon of truth.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: HIFF - Bouncing Cat
